page.title: 08EDUCATION IN HOLMESFIELD
page.content: A{village},{primary school}with 2 teachers and a headmaster serves our area.Fifty pupils aged between 5 and 11 attend the school.The number of pupils is decreasing due to an{ageing {population}and the advent of the{ {smaller family}.Many of the children live more than a mile away and so are allowed a{free taxi}to school.The school was built in 1894 and had its first pupils in 1895.Recently the school has been modernised.Most of the children consume school dinners which are cooked on the premises.The school is named after an ancient trust set up from proceeds of local produce to pay for a teacher. {Older children}are{bused}to the local secondary schools in Dronfield.
